Posts.Content: Hi   I have my second chemo next week. I shaved my head before chemo as didn’t want to experience the hair loss as well as everything else. My daughter cut it and then a friend shaved it. I did a sponsor me thing on Facebook and with old work colleagues and raised £1000 for cancer research. I found it really good to make something positive out of what could have been a really negative thing and am not bothered about the hair at all it’s just all the other crap side effects I’ve had! I’m on day 12 and only just starting to feel better save for crippling stomach cramps! I’m so looking forward to my “normal” week next week! Going to make plans every day And really enjoy it before the next lot xxx
Posts.Title: 2nd lot of chemo

Posts.Content: Hi, I was 29 when I was diagnosed last year, mine was 65mm tumour, grade 3. I had chemo, surgery then radio, her 2 positive. I remember the first few weeks after diagnosis and I felt like an alien in a sea of people, I hope you have people around u who are supporting you. I have just finished all the treatment and I have been told I am now evidence of disease!!! If you want to chat please feel free to contact me, Xxxx

Posts.Title: Breast cancer at 28

Posts.Content: Hello anyone out there. I found out four days ago I have grade three invasive ductal breast cancer and the two lymph nodes they did biopsy’s on also have cancer cells. My tumour is 45mm. I know it isn’t hormonal but waiting for her2 results. I am absolutely petrified. I am not handling it well at all. My whole body feels like there is something wrong and my head is all over the place. I have my ct scan on Wednesday and then an mri. I’m meeting my oc on Thursday to discuss the plan but they have already told me that it will be chemo then surgery then radiotherapy. I am so scared it has already spread everywhere and I am imagining that it’s in my brain and everywhere. I try to Be positive but I just can’t get over the fear and can’t sleep or eat. I am 29 years old, single mum and I have a four year old daughter who is my everything. I feel so sad and guilty about what this will mean for her. Any help advice stories of anyone with similar circumstances would be so appreciated. Thank you xxx
Posts.Title: Newly diagnosed grade 3 two lymph nodes 29years old please help m...

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for all your kind responses. I have calmed down a bit now, acceptance begins to sink in. My ct scan was clear which made me so so happy and more determined to fight. Mri showed lymph nodes which I already know about, and that my other lymph nodes on my left side are reactive whatever that means. I found out I’m her2 positive and I was given herceptin and chemo on Thursday and Friday this week. I feel drained this weekend and my body feels heavy but other than that I think it’s being kind to me so far.  I go from one day thinking that I will be ok, the next day thinking oh my god I’m going to die. I’ve given u reading take a break and that’s life as every other story is about someone who has died from breast cancer. I shaved my head for cancer research before I began the chemo and raised £1000 so I was really happy about that Survivor stories give me so much hope and motivation so thank you so much for all the kind ladies that have responded xxx
